name: Job Satisfaction (JS)
definition: A multidimensional construct measuring the degree to which individuals feel positive about various aspects of their jobs, encompassing satisfaction with pay, working conditions, supervision quality, and opportunities for advancement (Spector, 1997).

dimensions.name: Pay Satisfaction
dimensions.definition: The extent to which employees feel content with their compensation, benefits, and financial rewards relative to the work they perform.
example_items: I am satisfied with my current salary.
My pay reflects the effort I put into my work.

dimensions.name: Work Conditions
dimensions.definition: Satisfaction with the physical and social aspects of the work environment, including workspace quality, safety, and collegial relationships.
example_items: My workplace provides a comfortable environment for productive work.
I feel safe and supported in my work setting.

dimensions.name: Supervision Quality
dimensions.definition: Perceived quality of management practices, including fairness, communication, feedback, and supportiveness of direct supervisors.
example_items: My supervisor provides clear and constructive feedback.
I trust my supervisor to make fair decisions.

dimensions.name: Advancement Opportunities
dimensions.definition: The perceived availability and fairness of opportunities for career growth, skill development, and upward mobility within the organization.
example_items: There are sufficient opportunities for advancement in my organization.
I believe my efforts will lead to career growth.
